abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Improving Livestock
            Production and Marketing Project - A Pilot for Sudan were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Grantee performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            first, in a post conflict setting, empowering communities
            through capacity building is a key to development success.
            This also requires solid M&E systems and results
            framework to track and benchmark progress. Second, working
            in conflict-affected settings requires proactive supervision
            and 'contingent thinking' during project
            implementation. Third, the use of an independent monitoring
            agent (MA) in fragile-environments is instrumental to
            provide monitoring services and on-the-job capacity
            building. Fourth, community-driven restocking activities
            proved a success in enhancing livelihoods and building
            social capital. Finally, fifth, the experience of
            privatization of animal health services in North Kordofan
            set a nation-wide milestone.
